p: Still, when the same botanical species was mentioned in the two regions, it entered the matrix as two distinct entities (Plant A—Atlantic Forest and Plant A—Caatinga). Based on the binary matrix, the Jaccard similarity matrix was constructed. Pairs of plants with more than 50% of similarity were registered and classified as “redundant” (when they were plants from the same region) and “equivalents” (when they were plants from different regions).
